metadata.title: CVE-2024-40906 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:net/mlx5: Always stop health timer during driver removalCurrently, if teardown_hca fails to execute during driver removal, mlx5does not stop the health timer. Afterwards, mlx5 continue with driverteardown. This may lead to a UAF bug, which results in page faultOops[1], since the health timer invokes after resources were freed.Hence, stop the health monitor even if teardown_hca fails.[1]mlx5_core 0000:18:00.0: E-Switch: Unload vfs: mode(LEGACY), nvfs(0),necvfs(0), active vports(0)mlx5_core 0000:18:00.0: E-Switch: Disable: mode(LEGACY), nvfs(0),necvfs(0), active vports(0)mlx5_core 0000:18:00.0: E-Switch: Disable: mode(LEGACY), nvfs(0),necvfs(0), active vports(0)mlx5_core 0000:18:00.0: E-Switch: cleanupmlx5_core 0000:18:00.0: wait_func:1155:(pid 1967079): TEARDOWN_HCA(0x103)timeout.
